crawlResults.description: Get the results of a crawl job.

props.name: crawlId
props.description: The ID of the crawl job to check.

crawl.description: Crawl multiple pages from a website based on specified rules and patterns.

props.name: url
props.description: The base URL to start crawling from.

props.name: prompt
props.description: Describe what information you want to extract.

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl. Default limit is 10.

props.name: formats
props.description: Choose what format you want your output in.

props.name: onlyMainContent
props.description: Only return the main content of the page, excluding headers, navs, footers, etc.

props.name: extractMode
props.description: Data schema type.

props.name: extractSchema
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: name
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: description
props.description: Brief description of the data, this hints for the AI on what to look for

props.name: type
props.description: Type of parameter.

props.name: timeout
props.description: Timeout in seconds after which the task will be cancelled

props.name: useWebhook
props.description: Enable to send crawl results to a webhook URL.

props.name: webhookProperties
props.description: Properties for webhook configuration.

props.name: webhookUrl
props.description: The URL to send the webhook to. This will trigger for crawl started (crawl.started), every page crawled (crawl.page) and when the crawl is completed (crawl.completed or crawl.failed).

props.name: webhookHeaders
props.description: Headers to send to the webhook URL.

props.name: webhookMetadata
props.description: Custom metadata that will be included in all webhook payloads for this crawl.

props.name: webhookEvents
props.description: Type of events that should be sent to the webhook URL. (default: all)

extract.description: Extract structured data from multiple URLs using AI.

props.name: urls
props.description: Add one or more URLs to extract data from.

props.name: url
props.description: Website URL to extract data from

props.name: prompt
props.description: Describe what information you want to extract.

props.name: enableWebSearch
props.description: Enable web search to find additional context.

props.name: timeout
props.description: Timeout in seconds after which the task will be cancelled

props.name: schema
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: name
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: description
props.description: Brief description of the data, this hints for the AI on what to look for

props.name: type
props.description: Type of parameter.

map.description: Input a website and get all the urls on the website.

props.name: url
props.description: The webpage URL to start scraping from.

props.name: subdomain
props.description: Include and crawl pages from subdomains of the target website (e.g., blog.example.com, shop.example.com) in addition to the main domain.

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of links to return (max: 100,000)

scrape.description: Scrape a website by performing a series of actions like clicking, typing, taking screenshots, and extracting data.

props.name: url
props.description: The webpage URL to scrape.

props.name: timeout
props.description: Maximum time to wait for the page to load (in milliseconds).

props.name: useActions
props.description: Enable to perform a sequence of actions on the page before scraping (like clicking buttons, filling forms, etc.). See [Firecrawl Actions Documentation](https://docs.firecrawl.dev/api-reference/endpoint/scrape#body-actions) for details on available actions and their parameters.

props.name: actionProperties
props.description: Properties for actions that will be performed on the page.

props.name: actions
props.description: Sequence of actions to perform on the page.

props.name: formats
props.description: Choose what format you want your output in.

props.name: extractPrompt
props.description: Prompt for extracting data.

props.name: prompt
props.description: Describe what information you want to extract.

props.name: extractMode
props.description: Data schema type.

props.name: extractSchema
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Learn more about JSON Schema here: https://json-schema.org/learn/getting-started-step-by-step

props.name: fields
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: name
props.description: Provide the name of the value you want to extract from the unstructured text. The name should be unique and short.

props.name: description
props.description: Brief description of the data, this hints for the AI on what to look for

props.name: type
props.description: Type of parameter.
